quarks.oplet

Interface Oplet<I,O>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - Data container type for input tuples.
    O - Data container type for output tuples.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractOplet, Aggregate, CounterOp, Events, FanOut, Filter, FlatMap, Isolate, Map, Peek, Peek, PeriodicSource, Pipe, PressureReliever, ProcessSource, Publish, RateMeter, SingleMetricAbstractOplet, Sink, Source, Split, SupplierPeriodicSource, SupplierSource, Union, UnorderedIsolate

    public interface Oplet<I,O>
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Generic API for an oplet that processes streaming data on 0-N input ports and produces 0-M output streams on its output ports. An input port may be connected with any number of streams from other oplets. An output port may connected to any number of input ports on other oplets.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<? extends Consumer<I>> getInputs()
      Get the input stream data handlers for this oplet.
      void initialize(OpletContext<I,O> context)
      Initialize the oplet.
      void start()
      Start the oplet.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(OpletContext<I,O> context)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialize the oplet.
        Parameters:
        context -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • start

        void start()
        Start the oplet. Oplets must not submit any tuples not derived from input tuples until this method is called.

      • getInputs

        java.util.List<? extends Consumer<I>> getInputs()
        Get the input stream data handlers for this oplet. The number of handlers must equal the number of configured input ports. Each tuple arriving on an input port will be sent to the stream handler for that input port.
        Returns:
        list of consumers
